title: Sans font used by a railroad
content:
What typeface did they use for “Alaska” on the locomotives?

[http://www.railpictures.net/viewphoto.php?id=282793&nseq=53](http://web.archive.org/web/20090731144305/http:/www.railpictures.net/viewphoto.php?id=282793&nseq=53)
author: HSR Classic

comments.content: Almost certainly made by hand. Those strokes are a mess. If you like that kind of ’S’, check out [Apex Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20090731144305/http:/vllg.com/Thirstype/ApexSans/mudTyper+Weights/) and [Apex New](http://web.archive.org/web/20090731144305/http:/vllg.com/Thirstype/ApexNew/mudTyper+Weights/).
Really? I’ve seen sans serif lettering with an “S” very similar to that used elsewhere. Thanks for your help.

Antique Olive has a similar ’S’, but not a similar anything else.

- Lex
